1.str2: Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
An act of will, will; plur: wishes, desires. From the prolonged form of ethelo; a determination, i.e. choice or inclination.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
A promise. From epaggello; an announcement.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
Pity, mercy, compassion. Of uncertain affinity; compassion.

Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

Pity, mercy, compassion. Of uncertain affinity; compassion.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

18.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
18.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

18.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
18.str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
Better; adv: very well. Neuter of a compound of a derivative of ballo; better.

18.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Plural
18.str2: How much, how great, how many, as great as, as much. By reduplication from hos; as As.

18.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
18.str2: From diakonos; to be an attendant, i.e. Wait upon (figuratively) teacher; technically, to act as a Christian deacon.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Ephesus, a coast city, capital of the Roman province Asia. Probably of foreign origin; Ephesus, a city of Asia Minor.
